qas.question: How did the United States plan to subdue imperialistic tendencies?

answers.text: policies such as the Monroe Doctrine
policies such as the Monroe Doctrine

qas.question: What was the name of Theodore Roosevelt’s policy of imperialism?
Which country besides the Cuba did the United states try to annex in 1898?
What caused the US public to condemn the occupation of the philippines?
What did Smedley Butler call US foreign Policy?
How did the United States plan to subdue non-imperialistic tendencies?
What was the name of Theodore Roosevelt’s policy of non-imperialism?
Which country besides the Cuba did the United states not try to annex in 1898?
What caused the US public to support the occupation of the philippines?

context: The early United States expressed its opposition to Imperialism, at least in a form distinct from its own Manifest Destiny, <a0_1>through <a0_2><a0_3>policies<a0_1/> such as <a0_0>the <a0_4><b5_0>Monroe Doctrine<b5_0/><a0_4/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_0/>. However, beginning in the late 19th and early 20th century, policies such as Theodore Roosevelt’s <a1_0><a1_2><a1_3><a1_4><b6_0>interventionism<b6_0/><a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_0/> in Central America and Woodrow Wilson’s mission to "make the world safe for democracy" changed all this. They were often backed by military force, but were more often affected from behind the scenes. This is consistent with the general notion of hegemony and imperium of historical empires. In 1898, Americans who opposed imperialism created the Anti-Imperialist League to oppose the US annexation of <a2_0>the <a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><a2_4><b7_0>Philippines<b7_0/><a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> and Cuba. One year later, <a3_0><a3_1>a <a3_2><a3_3><a3_4><b8_0>war<a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_2/> erupted<b8_0/><a3_1/><a3_0/> in the Philippines causing business, labor and government leaders in the US to condemn America's occupation in the Philippines as they also denounced them for causing the deaths of many Filipinos. American foreign policy was denounced as <a4_0><a4_3>a "<a4_1><a4_2><a4_4>racket<a4_4/><a4_2/><a4_1/>"<a4_3/><a4_0/> by Smedley Butler, an American general. He said, "Looking back on it, I might have given Al Capone a few hints. The best he could do was to operate his racket in three districts. I operated on three continents"<a1_1>.
